conclusion: A scientific research team has developed a detector whose speed can be adjusted according to its motion.
The detector moves along the positive direction of the x-axis from the origin.
The velocity of the detector is inversely proportional to its displacement.
The velocities of the detector at points A and B are 4 m/s and 2 m/s, respectively.
The displacement from point O to point B is 2 m.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is to be determined.
The velocity at point B (where \\( x = 2 \\) m) is 2 m/s.
The constant of proportionality \\( k \\) is 4.
The displacement at point A is 1 m.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is \\( \frac{3}{8} \text{ s} \\).
